name: METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF VIDEO GAME COMEDY
name_original: METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF VIDEO GAME COMEDY
description:
The Metropolitan Museum of Video Game Comedy is a first person exploration of the history of comedy in video games. This piece focuses on a game jam that was hosted by Valve in early 2005. 

This game was made in the 2019 UAT Game Design Workshop game jam with the theme being abstract art. It is based off of the GDC talk How To Make Your Game Just Completely Hilarious: The Stanley Parable by William Pugh. 

Austin Herrington - Designer/Writer/Voice

Joshua Cazel - Programmer/Designer

Donna Dinh - Artist

Ian Favreau - Artist

Controls: WASD or Arrow Keys to move. Mouse to look. Left mouse button to interact with doors.
